meaningMnemonic:
When <kanji>medicine</kanji> is sent to your <kanji>direction</kanji> it's going to you. That's your <vocabulary> prescription</vocabulary>.

Note that 薬方 isn't commonly used in modern Japanese. You might encounter it in historical or fictional settings, where it can add a distinct flavor to the narrative.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
